frame.name: Compliance
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns <fen>Act</fen>s and <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen> for which <fen>Protagonist</fen>s are responsible and which either follow or violate some set of rules or <fen>Norm</fen>s. <ex></ex> <ex>A lot of people suspect that <fex name="Act">blocking savers' access to their money</fex> <t>violates</t> <fex name="Norm">the new constitution's explicit ban on compulsory loans to the government</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Not that by <t>adhering</t> <fex name="Norm">to the subject-before-predicate principle</fex>, <fex name="Protagonist">the translator of the above extract</fex> has had to ignore the principle of end-weight.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Protagonist
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s behavior is in or out of compliance with norms. <ex><fex name="Protagonist">Jo</fex> <t>violated</t> the no trespassing law.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Act
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that is judged to be in or out of compliance with the <fen>Norm</fen>s. <ex>Jo's <fex name="Act"><t>violation</t></fex> of the no trespassing law came as a surprise.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: State_of_affairs
FE.definition: <def-root>A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> may violate a law or rule. <ex><fex name="soa">Their pricing policy</fex> <t>violated</t> inter-governmental agreements.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Norm
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the rules or <fen>Norm</fen>s that ought to guide a person's behavior. <ex>John <t>violated</t> <fex name="Norm">the law</fex> by not paying taxes.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the compliance ocurrs.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> identifies any description of the Actor or Undergoer.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the compliance occurs. <ex>Jo <t>complied</t> with the law <fex name="Manner">willingly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the compliance is (or is not) accomplished. <ex>He <t>complied</t> with the decree <fex name="Mns">by firing the employees</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the act of compliance or non-compliance occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> for complying with the <fen>Norm</fen>. <ex>He <t>submitted</t> to the will of the king <fex name="exp">because he had no other choice</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: adhere.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: believe in and follow the practices of

lexUnit.name: comply.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: act in accordance with a wish or command

lexUnit.name: observe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fulfil or comply with

lexUnit.name: adherence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: believing in and following the practices of

lexUnit.name: compliance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or fact of being compliant

lexUnit.name: follow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: act according to (an instruction or precept)

lexUnit.name: observance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the practice of observing the requirements of law, morality, or ritual

lexUnit.name: break.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fail to observe (a law, regulation, or agreement)

lexUnit.name: violate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: break or fail to comply with (a rule or formal agreement)

lexUnit.name: contravene.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: offend against the prohibition or order of (a law, treaty, etc.)

lexUnit.name: breach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: break (a law, agreement, or code of conduct)

lexUnit.name: violation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: breaking or failing to comply with (a rule or formal agreement)

lexUnit.name: contravention.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an offense against the prohibition or order of a law, treaty, etc.

lexUnit.name: breach.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act of breaking a law, agreement, or code of conduct

lexUnit.name: flout.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: openly disregard (a rule, law, or convention)

lexUnit.name: conform.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: comply with rules, standards, or laws

lexUnit.name: obey.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: behave in accordance with (a general principle, natural law, etc.)

lexUnit.name: compliant.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: meeting or in accordance with rules or standards

lexUnit.name: transgress.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: go beyond the limits set by (a moral principle, standard, law, etc.)

lexUnit.name: transgression.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a excession of the limits set by (a moral principle, standard, law, etc.)

lexUnit.name: lawless.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not governed by or obedient to laws.

lexUnit.name: contrary.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not in conformity with what is usual or what is expected

lexUnit.name: conformity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: compliance with conventions, rules, or laws.

lexUnit.name: keep.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: fulfil a commitment

lexUnit.name: honor.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fulfil (an obligation) or keep (an agreement).

lexUnit.name: abide (by).v
lexUnit.definition: FN: comply

lexUnit.name: obedient.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: complying (with a duty)

lexUnit.name: observant.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: observing the rules of a religion.

lexUnit.name: play by the rules.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: conform to social or other, more specific norms

lexUnit.name: circumvent.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: break (a treaty or agreement), us. with the intent of not revealing the breach.

lexUnit.name: noncompliance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: Not obeying rules.

lexUnit.name: (in/out of) line.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be in compliance (with a rule or expectation).

lexUnit.name: disobey.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to fall out of compliance with some set of rules or an authority's explicit direction.

lexUnit.name: in accordance.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be in compliance with a Norm; usually followed by "with"

lexUnit.name: by-pass.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: avoid or circumvent rules to accomplish a goal.
